Class Dates

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • Dates
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ToolkitConstants, java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class Dates
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
implements ToolkitConstants
    Provide GUI support for the Dates program. The Dates program permits conversions to and from a number of date systems, such as Julian, Modified Julian, Day of Year and Chandra Time.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • service

        public void service(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
             throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                    java.io.IOException
        Handle a submission from a browser. Five operations are provided:
        1. CLEAR - reset the session variables to their default state.
        2. CALCULATE - check for input errors and execute the command line tool.
        3. VIEW OUTPUT - display the output from the command line tool.
        4. HELP - display the generic toolkit help file.
        Overrides:
        service in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        request - The request object as passed in by the browser.
        response - The response object that will be passed back to the browser.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException

        inputCalendarCode - input calendar data format
        outputCalendarCode - output calendar data format
        inputValue - input value
        destination - output results
        validator - validator for input values

      • trimZeroes

        private java.lang.String trimZeroes(java.lang.String str)
        Parameters:
        str - a string of the form dddd[.ddddd] where `d' can be one of [0-9].

        If str represents an empty character sequence, or the first and last characters in str both have non-zero characters, then the input str object is returned.

        Otherwise, a new string is created by removing leading and trailing zeroes.

        If this new string is empty or ".", then "0" is returned.

        If the new string is of the form "dddddd." then a single trailing zero is appended and the resultant string returned.

        If the new string is of the form ".ddddd" then a single leading zero is prepended the resultant string returned.

        Otherwise, the new string is returned unmodified.

        Returns:
        a string with excess leading or trailing zeroes removed.

      • getRangeKey

        private java.lang.String getRangeKey(java.lang.String format)
        Returns a string key used to look up limits for a particular date format. Null is returned if there are no bounds on the input.
        Parameters:
        format - The selected input format.
        Returns:
        A string (possibly null) used to lookup a range for validating a particular input format.

      • initializeInputValues

        private void initializeInputValues(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                   boolean clear)
        Initialize input parameters. Each parameter is processed as follows: 1) The clear flag is false: if the parameter has been passed in this request packet, then the value is stored in the session (cookie). If the parameter is not passed and a session value exists, then nothing is done with the value. If no value exists for the session value, then it is set to the default value. 2) The clear flag is true: the session value is set to the default.
        Parameters:
        request - The servlet request.
        clear - If set use the default value.

      • initializeOutputValues

        private void initializeOutputValues(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                    boolean clear)
        Initialize output parameters. Each parameter is processed as follows: 1) The clear flag is false: if the parameter has been passed in this request packet, then the value is stored in the session (cookie). If the parameter is not passed and a session value exists, then nothing is done with the value. If no value exists for the session value, then it is set to the default value. 2) The clear flag is true: the session value is set to the default.
        Parameters:
        request - The servlet request.
        clear - If set use the default value.
